metadata.title: How to Moderate YouTube Comments 2025: Comment Settings Guide
metadata.description: Manage YouTube comments effectively. Moderation settings, filters, and community management.

hero.headline: How to Moderate YouTube Comments
hero.subheadline: Build healthy community. Control spam and negativity effectively.

sections.content: Comment moderation protects your community and your sanity. YouTube provides powerful tools to filter spam, hold comments for review, and block problematic users. Proper moderation creates a welcoming space while reducing the toxicity that can burn out creators.

content.title: Hold for Review
content.description: All comments require approval before appearing publicly.

content.title: Increase Strictness
content.description: Let YouTube auto-hold likely spam and inappropriate comments.

content.title: Block Words
content.description: Custom list of words that auto-hold or hide comments.

content.title: Moderators
content.description: Assign trusted users to help moderate. They can approve/remove comments.

content.title: Hidden Users
content.description: Ban specific users. Their comments only visible to them.

content.title: Approved Users
content.description: Whitelist trusted commenters. Their comments auto-approved.

content.title: Link Blocking
content.description: Auto-hold comments with links. Common spam vector.

faq.question: Should I hold all comments for review?
faq.answer: Only for very sensitive content or small channels wanting full control. Otherwise, increased strictness is enough. Full review becomes unmanageable at scale.

faq.question: How to handle hate comments?
faq.answer: Remove and optionally hide user. Don't respond—it encourages more. Report if severely violating. Focus energy on positive community.

faq.question: Can viewers see if they're hidden?
faq.answer: No—hidden users see their own comments normally. They don't know they're hidden. It's shadow-ban functionality.

faq.question: How many moderators can I have?
faq.answer: YouTube allows multiple moderators. Add trusted community members. They can approve/remove comments but not access your channel settings.
